info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 02 at 10:58AM CST until February 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with higher amounts of 3 to 7 inches possible for portions of western north Texas through central Oklahoma. Winds gusting as high as 40mph For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Hardeman and Foard Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia in a short amount of time if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call 8 0 0 4 5 2 9 2 9 2 for road information.
